body:
Comment 4: 
Arguably the EBNF is not correct in this case: In general the EBNF is looser than what
is permitted by the language (because it makes the EBNF easier to read); in this case
arguably the "..." for append is not permitted.

It is correct that from a purely syntactic point of view, for all the built-ins that
don't take a type as first argument, the standard call syntax would work too, and append
would be covered there (and even some of the built-ins accepting types if the type is an
identifier). But we have deliberately chosen to give the productions names with semantic
meaning ("BuiltinCall") so that we can refer to them from the prose.
_Owner changed to @griesemer._ _Status changed to **Accepted**._
